Regional Business Manager Job at Grand Oak Limited




        
    

        
        Grand Oak Limited (GOL) - We are the largest manufacturer of spirits and wines, we believe our spirits should have character; an authenticity derived from where they are distilled, bottled and the philosophies of those who distil them. There are many attributes that describe us resolute, self-sufficient, tough, hard-working, enduring, emotional, passionate, philosophical and engaging.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Regional Business Manager
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos

??Job Summary
     

            
    




	Drive regional business growth and revenue by leading and managing a team of sales professionals, executing sales strategies, and building strong relationships with customers and partners to achieve business objectives and expand market share.


Responsibilities


	Strategic Sales Management: Develop and execute regional sales strategies to drive revenue growth, expand market share, and achieve business objectives.
	Analyse market trends, competitor activity, and customer needs to inform sales strategies.
	Stock Management: Optimize stock levels, inventory management, and logistics to ensure product availability, minimize waste, and reduce costs.
	Implement effective stock management processes and procedures to ensure regional compliance.
	Cost Management: Manage and control regional operating expenses, ensuring alignment with budget and company objectives. Identify opportunities to reduce costs, improve efficiency, and enhance profitability.
	Coaching, Mentoring & Training: Lead, coach, and develop a high-performing sales team, providing guidance, support, and training to enhance skills and knowledge.
	Foster a culture of continuous learning, innovation, and excellence within the regional sales team.
	Training: Identify skill gaps in the sales workforce through an accompanied market visit for Individual Development Plan (IDP), provide training tools (Computer, vehicles, SFA device, Tabs etc) 24/7 online presence for capacity building and effectiveness.
	In-depth knowledge and understanding of company policies and processes for alignment with business objectives.


Challenges:


	General economic environment
	Manning gap replacement
	Security threat and risk to life within the region
	Extensive travelling away from family
	Logistics delay in stock delivery
	Ravelling associated hazards


Framework & Boundaries:


	This role reports to the G.M Sales & Operations and interfaces with Logistics, Finance and Supply Chain.


Job Dimensions:


	Key people measures – 1
	Key financial measures – sales turnover
	Key quality measures – N/A
	Key production measures – volume delivery


KPIs


	20% product penetration across all channels
	Conversion rate
	Call completion


Requirements


	Minimum requirement: First Degree / HND from a recognised institution with a grade not less than a Second Class Lower or Lower Credit in Economics, Business Administration or any numerate course.
	Added advantage: MBA
	Minimum requirement: 5 years of cognate experience
	Added Advantage: Professional Membership & Certifications
	Minimum requirement: ICAN


Key Competencies Requirements:


	Wholesale and retail process expertise
	Analytical and problem-solving skills
	Leadership skills
	Technical skills
	Time management.

IT Officer Job at Grand Oak Limited




        
    

        
        Grand Oak Limited is part of a team committed to working together across companies. Only by sharing ideas, technologies and talents can the Group achieve and sustain profitable growth Keeping Commitment. We believe that following through on promises is the best way to maintain credibility with colleagues, employees and customers Continuous Improvement.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Officer
Job Location: Sango Ota, Ogun
Employment Type: Contract

Job Description
     

            
    




	Working through the shared services business unit, this role is reaponsible for assisting at monitoring the network infrastructure and providing cyber security support to the business for optimal safety and reliability of IT and systems infrasture.


Challenges:


	User compliance.
	Rapid technological Obsolescence.
	Vendor related problems.


Context of Job:
Framework & Boundaries:


	This role provides adequate technical assistance and helps increase staff productivity by managing allocation of tool, and training of staff on tools and system updates.


Principal Accountabilities


	Assist the I.T & Systems Manager in creating network policies in order to safeguard organizational data and the network from cyber security threats.
	Responsible for supporting the optimization of network server and storage infrastructure for a secured and reliable network infrastructure.
	Assist with the configuration and installation of software systems for seamless operations across all SBUs.
	Monitor system performance and alertness levels to address potential issues in a timely way by conducting regular security audits across the shared business unit.


Requirements
Education:


	Minimum requirement: First Degree / HND Certificate from a recognized higher institution in an IT, Engineering or any other numerate course, with a grade not less than a Second Class lower or a Lower Credit.


Experience:


	Minimum requirement: Minimum of 1 year of cognate experience.
	Added Advantage: Experience in network infrastructure and cyber security.


Key Competencies:


	Strong technical background and knowledge of IT systems, networks, and software applications.
	Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot technical issues.
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work proactively and independently.
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
	Ability to work independently.


Salary
N60,000 - N80,000 / Month.

Assistant Business Analyst Job at Grand Oak Limited




        
    

        
        Grand Oak Limited (GOL)  - We are the largest Manufacturer of SpiritsandWines, we believe our spirits should have character; an authenticity derived from where they are distilled, bottled and the philosophies of those who distil them.

There are many attributes that describe us resolute, self-sufficient, tough, hard-working, enduring, emotional, passionate, philosophical and engaging.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Business Analyst

Job Location: Sango Ota, Ogun

Summary
     

            
    




	The Business Analyst is responsible for providing effective sales and administrative support to the Fountain Head Director and field representatives in collation, analysis, and presentation of accurate sales reports for strategic sales decision-making.


Job Description


	Ensure all sales performance and stock analysis reports are accurate and timely.
	Liaise with Distributor Development Managers & logistics team to ensure effective distribution of stock.
	Ensure achievement of e-commerce sales target.
	Track/monitor the use of sales tools such as Fieldmax and appraise the gaps/required improvement in line with the dictate of the market.
	Prepare a sales process compliance report.
	Handle specific sales development project as assigned by the Fountain Head Director for the purpose of achieving set business objectives.
	Ensure all special redistribution target is achieved.
	Provide sales BSC report as at when due.


Qualifications


	First Degree.
	MBA qualification will be an added advantage.
	Minimum work experience of 5 years.


The person must:


	Possess excellent analytical & MS Excel skills.
	Have excellent presentation & communication skills.
	Have proper understanding of supply chain and logistics process.
	Be able to multi-task & work under pressure.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 monthly.
